meanings.definition: A person who sets type for printing.
meanings.sent1: The compositors worked diligently to set the type for the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: The compositors at the printing press carefully arranged the letters for the book.
meanings.sent3: The compositors decided to have a race to see who could set the type the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a busy compositors, arranging thoughts into coherent sentences.
meanings.sent5: The compositors skillfully crafted each letter into place, like a puzzle coming together.

meanings.definition: A machine used for setting type.
meanings.sent1: The old compositors clanked and whirred as they set the type for the poster.
meanings.sent2: The compositors in the print shop were essential for creating newspapers.
meanings.sent3: The compositors machine seemed to have a mind of its own, typing out words at lightning speed.
meanings.sent4: The compositors hummed like a contented worker, churning out words effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The compositors machine was a marvel of engineering, transforming blank pages into stories.

meanings.definition: A person who arranges or organizes elements into a unified whole.
meanings.sent1: As a compositors of flavors, she mixed ingredients to create the perfect dish.
meanings.sent2: The compositors of the art exhibition carefully placed each painting for maximum impact.
meanings.sent3: The compositors of the team meeting decided to have a themed agenda for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a compositors, blending ideas into a cohesive plan.
meanings.sent5: The compositors of the orchestra harmonized the instruments into a beautiful symphony.
